instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .
definitions.P5VG3S_PGOOD: What is P5VG3S_PGOOD? P5VG3S_PGOOD is a signal that indicates that the PP5V_G3S power rail is functioning properly. .
definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Arrived with liquid damage around <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>. Before starting repair board was slightly turning on and charging battery.

After replacing <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> and surrounding components board now only has a 12.30V <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and power cycles every few seconds. Solders are good on <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>

What should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Something else affected by liquid, possibly CPU, or other BGA chip.
You should inspect small resistors and traces too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
The only section of the board that had liquid was around <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>. Resistors and traces have been inspected thoroughly.  The spill was minor.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.33V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> 0.863V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
The resistors and traces have been inspected along with continuity testing. The minor spill occured only in the <CHIP>U7650</CHIP> area.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.33V

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> 0.860V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: So, you have steady 12.3V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, or power cycling?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: steady 12.3V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.message:
Do you have a board view for this? The <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> I have has different layout.

Also noticed the board is power cycling now. T2 chip in particular is heating up then cooling down on infrared camera every few seconds.
